Experience Web Team Lead and Project Manager of User Experience / Design Cisco Systems April 2013  – Present (2 years 5 months) San Jose, CA Converted from a contractor to a full-time employee at Cisco Systems. In addition to acting as a Web Team Lead and a Project Manager, I am also working on co-managing User Experience / Design work for a new software product to be launched in 2015. Web Team Lead and Project Manager Cisco Systems (Spherion) September 2010  –  April 2013  (2 years 8 months) San Jose, CA Promoted in September of 2010, to Web Team Lead, in addition to current role. Began managing User Experience / Design projects in 2011.  
 
User Experience / Design: Performed needs analysis and user surveys as a precursor to design initiation. Participated in and lead design sessions and conducted design reviews. Adhered to Cisco branding and standards to ensure a consistent look and feel throughout all web platforms. Created user stories, site concepts, wireframes, user flows, design mockups, interface designs, and technical architecture of websites and web platforms. 
 
Web Team Lead: Responsible for managing a team of four employees that are responsible for editing, updating, and creating Cisco Certification web pages on the Training and Events section on Cisco.com and the Learning@Cisco team pages on the company’s intranet site. 
 
Program Management: Created a formal program to manage web activities on various web platforms for Learning@Cisco. Identified work process improvements and implemented formalized processes and procedures to improve request management, assignment, and completion. 
 
Project Management: Managed cross-functional web projects using traditional and agile project management methodologies. Managed web team projects through all the project phases including initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing. Participated in all phases of project design, development, testing, and production. 
 
Analysis: Helped define project scope by studying strategic business drivers; discovering and validating business and technical requirements and parameters; and obtaining input from subject-matter experts. Project and Program Manager - Acrolinx IQ Cisco Systems (Spherion) April 2009  –  April 2013  (4 years 1 month) San Jose, CA Selected by a former colleague to lead a project involving the development and implementation of a quality assurance tool called acrolinx IQ and to manage the program after implementation. Responsible for working with the vendor company to customize the tool against Cisco writing standards and guidelines, while meeting the project’s milestones and deadlines. 
 
Program Management: Created the program around the implementation, rollout, and ongoing use of Acrolinx IQ. Created administrative guides, installation guides, user newsletters, new user information email templates, and user trainings. Managed issuance of user licenses. Conducted user trainings and provided one-on-one training for users. Captured user metrics on a monthly basis and provided reporting on the tool. Acted as a first-level of support to all users. Updated the tool on the backend to improve tool functionality and usability. Provided consultation to another Cisco group developing an instance of acrolinx IQ. Managed contractual agreements and budget for the program. 
 
Project Management: Managed the project through the following project phases: executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing. Participated in project development, testing, and production.
